required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adverse Health Effects of Mainstream and Secondhand Hookah Smoke in NYC Hookah Bars
clinical_study.official_title: Adverse Health Effects of Mainstream and Secondhand Hookah Smoke in NYC Hookah Bars

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to examine the health effects of mainstream and secondhand hookah (i.e. water pipe) smoke on pulmonary and cardiovascular functions as well as serum levels of inflammatory biomarkers. Investigators would like to demonstrate that inhalation of both mainstream and secondhand smoke generated by hookah produces adverse pulmonary and cardiovascular effects and alterations in serum levels of inflammatory biomarkers.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 20 participants are going to be enrolled in this study; 10 participants smoke hookah and 10 participants are exposed to second hand hookah smoke for 2 hours in NYC hookah bars. Subjects in the control group will also be paired as they were for the hookah bar visit but will visit a control location, where they will be asked to consume a similar amount of food and drink at a wine bar. Pulmonary function, cardiovascular changes, and blood and urine markers of inflammatory mediators before, immediately after and 24 hours after the participants' visits to hookah bars and wine bars will be examined. Air quality monitoring will also be performed at the hookah bar and at the control location. Physiological changes will be assessed by measuring pulmonary function, blood pressure, heart rate, and blood oxygenation status. To determine the extent of tobacco exposure and associated inflammatory changes from secondhand hookah smoke, investigators will measure blood inflammatory biomarkers, oxidative stress, gene expression, tobacco-related carcinogenic metabolites, and exhaled carbon dioxide levels.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in exhaled carbon dioxide measured by pulmonary function measure using a portable spirometer
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking or smoke exposure and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Heart Rate measured by a portable monitor worn during encounters
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood oxygenation levels measured by a pulse oximeter
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of tobacco-related carcinogenic metabolite cotinine in saliva samples
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker endothelin
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker IL-10
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker CRP
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker IL-1a
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker IFN-g
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker TNF-a
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker GM-CSF
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker E-selectin
primary_outcome.time_frame: subsequently after 2 hours of hookah smoking and 24 hours after participants' visit hookah and wine bars.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker thrombomodulin

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in measure of blood inflammatory marker vWF

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Air Quality measured by an aethelometer

arm_group.description: 10 participants will smoke tobacco hookah for 2 hours
10 individuals will be exposed to secondhand hookah tobacco smoke for 2 hours

intervention.intervention_name: Active smoking of Tobacco Hookah for 2 hours
Exposure to tobacco hookah second hand smoke

intervention.description: Participants will visit a wine bar for food and/or drinks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Competent adult English speaking subjects
- Have used hookah in the past
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <21
- Pregnancy
- Current cigarette smokers
- Has pulmonary disease, such as asthma or Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
- Subjects are unable to give voluntary informed consent because they are non English speaking, are unable to read or write, or any other impediments that prohibits giving written informed consent
- Recent nasal surgery (within 6 months)
- History of bleeding or other blood related disorder.

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine
